intro: Calceolaria hyssopifolia, commonly known as the purple pansy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, hooded flowers that resemble small pansies. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Calceolaria hyssopifolia is known for its vibrant, bi-colored petals that range from purple to white and yellow.
